pronunciation: MOR'TIFY, [Latin mors, death, and facio, to make.]

definitions.text:
Mortify
1. To destroy the organic texture vital functions of some part of living animal; change sphacelus gangrene. Extreme inflammation speedily mortifies flesh.
2. To subdue bring into subjection, as the bodily appetites by abstinence rigorous severities.We mortify ourselves with fish.With fasting mortified, worn out with tears.
3. To subdue; abase; humble; reduce; restrain; as inordinate passions.Mortify thy learned lust.Mortify therefore your members which are upon the earth. Colossians 3:5.
4. To humble; depress; affect with slight vexation.How often is the ambitious man mortified with the very praises he receives, they do not rise so high as he thinks they ought.He is controlled by nod, mortified by frown, transported with smile.
5. To destroy active powers essential qualities.He mortified pearls vinegar--Quicksilver--mortified with turpentine.[I believe this application is not now use.]MOR'TIFY,

To lose vital heat action suffer the dissolution of organic texture, as flesh; corrupt gangrene.
1. To be subdued.
2. To practice severities penance from religious motives.This makes him give alms of all that he hath, watch, fast mortify
